e4: In light of the current policy's ethical concerns and potential legal repercussions, it is recommended to change to the new policy for a transparent reporting system, even though short-term market volatility may be anticipated. The board and management should develop an effective communication plan to address investor concerns and maintain fairness among all investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy would be transparent, consistent, and accurate in its calculations. It should not mislead investors or disadvantage certain stakeholders. Considerations include full disclosure of adjustments made to earnings, minimizing bias, treating all investors fairly, and complying with relevant laws such as those set by the Securities and Exchange Commission.
e6: Follow-up questions for management: Would you consider a phased implementation of the new policy to minimize short-term market impacts and ensure transparency with retail investors? Have you considered providing additional education to retail investors about the change in reporting policies, thus allowing them to make informed decisions?
q9: Oumuamua, first interstellar object detected passing through our Solar System
